intro: Crepis neglecta subsp. cretica, commonly known as the Cretan mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a small annual or biennial herb with hairy, linear leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and its ability to thrive in arid conditions. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
